examples: true, she is the smartest in her class

results.definition: make level, square, balanced, or concentric
examples: true up the cylinder of an engine
the window frame isn't quite true

results.definition: not pretended; sincerely felt or expressed
examples: true grief
a true note
the true and lawful king
he was true to his word
I would be true for there are those who trust me
his aim was true

results.definition: expressing or given to expressing the truth
examples: a true statement
the horseshoe crab is not a true crab
Pythagoras was the first true mathematician

results.definition: consistent with fact or reality; not false
examples: the story is true
it is undesirable to believe a proposition when there is no ground whatever for supposing it true
the true meaning of the statement

results.definition: determined with reference to the earth's axis rather than the magnetic poles
examples: true north is geographic north

results.definition: devoted (sometimes fanatically) to a cause or concept or truth
examples: true believers bonded together against all who disagreed with them

results.definition: proper alignment; the property possessed by something that is in correct or proper alignment
examples: out of true
true courage
a spirit which true men have always admired
a true friend
